Okay, here is the text for you to summarize:

“Many students seeking career opportunities begin with internships. Internships provide valuable hands-on experience, allowing students to apply classroom learning to real-world situations. They also offer a chance to network with industry professionals and gain a better understanding of different career paths. Internships can often lead to full-time job offers upon graduation.

However, securing a full-time job after graduation is increasingly competitive. Recent graduates often face challenges in differentiating themselves from other candidates. Skills gaps, a lack of relevant experience, and competition for limited positions contribute to this difficulty. Many companies prioritize candidates with internships or prior work experience.

To improve chances of success, students should actively pursue internships during their studies. Building a strong resume and cover letter is crucial. Networking events and informational interviews can also be beneficial. Developing strong technical skills and soft skills, such as communication and teamwork, is vital. Furthermore, adapting to the changing demands of the job market and continually learning new skills are essential for long-term career success. Focusing on skills that are in demand, like data analysis or digital marketing, can significantly increase employability. Finally, a proactive and persistent approach to job searching is key.”

Support included interview techniques and networking strategies. The goal was proactive relationship building and positive interactions to support career advancement.

Career guidance programs fostered connections between students, alumni, and recruiters. These programs centered on relationships among students, faculty, and mentors. Alumni shared insights regarding the advantages of practical experience, including internships and part-time employment. Counselors delivered personalized assistance for academic planning, course selection, and professional skill development. Students accessed resources for crafting resumes and cover letters, conducting job searches, and preparing for interviews. Guidance panels and business card exchanges were utilized. Counselors connected students with companies and distributed relevant brochures. Assessments and discussions helped identify student interests, skills, and values. Support included interview techniques and networking strategies. The program’s objective was proactive relationship building and positive interactions to facilitate student career progression.
